p: We combined transcriptome sets downloaded from NCBI, including transcripts from leaves, stems and roots as described in the Methods. D e novo assembly yielded 164,548 unigenes from the three tissues (Additional file 1: Figure S1, Additional file 1: Table S2). Many unigenes were identified as SaTPS genes, including 38 core terpene synthase genes and nine triterpene-specific synthase genes (Additional file 1: Table S3). Of these, six unigene sequences were completely aligned with those of S. album submitted to NCBI [ 40, 42, 45]. Three unigenes contained full-length ORFs encoding TPSs, designated as SaTPS1 to 3. In order to confirm that the assembled unigenes generated using the Trinity assembler were accurate, we designed primers to anneal around the predicted start and stop codons of unigenes to amplify ORFs of the three predicted SaTPS genes (Fig. S2). Subsequent sequencing of these nucleotides demonstrated that they were exactly as predicted by the unigene assembly.
